intro: Dombeya bemarivensis var. coursii, commonly known as the Madagascar dombeya, is a flowering plant native to the island of Madagascar. It is characterized by its showy, bell-shaped flowers that typically range in color from white to pink. The plant belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. It thrives in humid, tropical climates and is often found in forested areas. Its ornamental value makes it a sought-after species for horticultural cultivation.
